edu.stanford.cs.pptx.code

Class PPStackFrame

  • Object
    • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPShape
      • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.PPGroup
        • edu.stanford.cs.pptx.code.PPStackFrame

  • public class PPStackFrame
extends PPGroup
    This class represents a stack frame in the pptx.code package.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PPStackFrame(double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a PPStackFrame with the specified bounds.
      PPStackFrame(Rectangle2D bb)
      Creates a PPStackFrame from the bounding box.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PPStackFrame

        public PPStackFrame(double x,
                    double y,
                    double width,
                    double height)
        Creates a PPStackFrame with the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the upper left corner
        y - The y coordinate of the upper left corner
        width - The width of the stack frame in pixels
        height - The height of the stack frame in pixels

      • PPStackFrame

        public PPStackFrame(Rectangle2D bb)
        Creates a PPStackFrame from the bounding box.
        Parameters:
        bb - The bounding box

    • Method Detail

      • addVariable

        public void addVariable(PPVariable var)
        Adds a new variable to the stack frame.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to be added

      • pushFrame

        public void pushFrame()
        Makes this stack frame appear as if in a function call. The standard visual model is to have the frame fly in from the bottom right.

      • pushFrame

        public void pushFrame(String options)
        Makes this stack frame appear as if in a function call. This version of the function takes an option string, which can be used to override the default animation behavior.
        Parameters:
        options - The option string

      • popFrame

        public void popFrame()
        Makes this stack frame disappear as when a function returns. The standard visual model is to have the frame zoom and fade out.

      • popFrame

        public void popFrame(String options)
        Makes this stack frame disappear as when a function returns. This version of the function takes an option string, which can be used to override the default animation behavior.
        Parameters:
        options - The option string

      • setCode

        public void setCode(String[] code)
        Sets the code for the stack frame. Clients must set all the properties that affect the appearance of the code before calling setCode.
        Parameters:
        code - The array of lines that comprise the code

      • setSpacing

        public void setSpacing(double spacing)
        Sets the line spacing.
        Parameters:
        spacing - The line spacing in points

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Font font)
        Sets the font for the code.
        Parameters:
        font - The font for the code

      • setFont

        public void setFont(String str)
        Sets the font for the code. In this version of setFont, the font is expressed as a string in the form 
            "family-style-size"
        Parameters:
        str - A string representing the font

      • setLeftMargin

        public void setLeftMargin(double margin)
        Sets the left margin for the code box.
        Parameters:
        margin - The left margin

      • setTopMargin

        public void setTopMargin(double margin)
        Sets the top margin for the code box.
        Parameters:
        margin - The top margin

      • getCodeBounds

        public Rectangle2D getCodeBounds(int line)
        Returns the rectangular region that bounds the specified line.
        Parameters:
        line - The line number
        Returns:
        A Rectangle2D that encloses the entire line

      • getCodeBounds

        public Rectangle2D getCodeBounds(int line,
                                 int p1,
                                 int p2)
        Returns the rectangular region that bounds the specified substring of the code line.
        Parameters:
        line - The line number
        p1 - The index of the starting character
        p2 - The index of the character following the end
        Returns:
        A Rectangle2D that encloses the code
